definition: to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: So this is a great way to kill two birds with one stone.
sentences.chinese: 但確是一個一石二鳥的好方法。

sentences.english: Final Zhang Quanzhong hostage of one rescue of Shi Erdiao success peddles poison catch the whole lot in an action.
sentences.chinese: 最後張全忠一石二鳥成功解救人質並將毒販一網打盡。

sentences.english: That guy revenged on his enemy by planning to kill two birds with one stone .
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙計劃用一石二鳥的方法向仇人報復。

sentences.english: 'The U. S. killed two birds with one stone, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 申善浩說，美國達到了“一石二鳥”的效果。

sentences.english: Where can you hit 2 birds with 1 stone?
sentences.chinese: 在哪些事情上你可以一石二鳥呢？

sentences.english: This way! he can kill two pets with one stone.
Second, kill two birds with one stone.
In doing so, you "kill two birds with one stone".
sentences.chinese: 而你這樣做的時候，同時也是一石二鳥。

definition: variant of 熱衷|热衷[re4 zhong1]
touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
